stimulusHtml:

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for calculating the correct volume of 12.3 M HCl.

2.0 mol HCl 1000. mL ×50.0 mL=0.10 mol HCl MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaSaaaeaaca aIYaGaaiOlaiaaicdacaqGGaGaaeyBaiaab+gacaqGSbGaaeiiaiaa bIeacaqGdbGaaeiBaaqaaiaaigdacaaIWaGaaGimaiaaicdacaGGUa Gaaeiiaiaab2gacaqGmbaaaiabgEna0kaaiwdacaaIWaGaaiOlaiaa icdacaqGGaGaaeyBaiaabYeacqGH9aqpcaaIWaGaaiOlaiaaigdaca aIWaGaaeiiaiaab2gacaqGVbGaaeiBaiaabccacaqGibGaae4qaiaa bYgaaaa@569E@

1 point is earned for adding acid to water in the dilution process.

1000. mL 12.3 mol HCl ×0.10 mol HCl=8.1 mL MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaSaaaeaaca aIXaGaaGimaiaaicdacaaIWaGaaiOlaiaabccacaqGTbGaaeitaaqa aiaaigdacaaIYaGaaiOlaiaaiodacaqGGaGaaeyBaiaab+gacaqGSb GaaeiiaiaabIeacaqGdbGaaeiBaaaacqGHxdaTcaaIWaGaaiOlaiaa igdacaaIWaGaaeiiaiaab2gacaqGVbGaaeiBaiaabccacaqGibGaae 4qaiaabYgacqGH9aqpcaaI4aGaaiOlaiaaigdacaqGGaGaaeyBaiaa bYeaaaa@56A6@

1 point is earned for filling the volumetric to the 50.00 mL mark with distilled water.

Pour some distilled water into the volumetric flask so it is about half full. Use the graduated cylinder to measure 8.1 mL of 12.3 M HCl and pour it into the volumetric flask. Add a few mL of distilled water to the graduated cylinder, swirl, and add the liquid to the volumetric flask. Swirl the flask to mix. Carefully add more distilled water to the flask, using the dropper for the last few mL to fill the flask to the mark with distilled water.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for calculating the correct volume of 12.3 M HCl.

1 point is earned for adding acid to water in the dilution process.

1000. mL 12.3 mol HCl ×0.10 mol HCl=8.1 mL MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaSaaaeaaca aIXaGaaGimaiaaicdacaaIWaGaaiOlaiaabccacaqGTbGaaeitaaqa aiaaigdacaaIYaGaaiOlaiaaiodacaqGGaGaaeyBaiaab+gacaqGSb GaaeiiaiaabIeacaqGdbGaaeiBaaaacqGHxdaTcaaIWaGaaiOlaiaa igdacaaIWaGaaeiiaiaab2gacaqGVbGaaeiBaiaabccacaqGibGaae 4qaiaabYgacqGH9aqpcaaI4aGaaiOlaiaaigdacaqGGaGaaeyBaiaa bYeaaaa@56A6@

1 point is earned for filling the volumetric to the 50.00 mL mark with distilled water.

Pour some distilled water into the volumetric flask so it is about half full. Use the graduated cylinder to measure 8.1 mL of 12.3 M HCl and pour it into the volumetric flask. Add a few mL of distilled water to the graduated cylinder, swirl, and add the liquid to the volumetric flask. Swirl the flask to mix. Carefully add more distilled water to the flask, using the dropper for the last few mL to fill the flask to the mark with distilled water.

The student response earns one of the following points:

1 point is earned for filling the volumetric to the 50.00 mL mark with distilled water.

Pour some distilled water into the volumetric flask so it is about half full. Use the graduated cylinder to measure 8.1 mL of 12.3 M HCl and pour it into the volumetric flask. Add a few mL of distilled water to the graduated cylinder, swirl, and add the liquid to the volumetric flask. Swirl the flask to mix. Carefully add more distilled water to the flask, using the dropper for the last few mL to fill the flask to the mark with distilled water.
